comp303.fivehundred.ai
Class RandomRobot

java.lang.Object
  comp303.fivehundred.ai.RandomRobot
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBiddingStrategy, ICardExchangeStrategy, IPlayingStrategy, IRobotPlayer
public class RandomRobot
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRobotPlayer

Plays correctly but randomly, i.e., very badly.

Method Detail

selectBid

public Bid selectBid(Bid[] pPreviousBids,
                     Hand pHand)
Description copied from interface: IBiddingStrategy
Produces a valid bid, i.e., a between 6 and 10 for any suit or no trump, that is higher that the last bid.

Specified by:
selectBid in interface IBiddingStrategy
Parameters:
pPreviousBids - All the previous bids for this hand, in order. The size of the array is the number of bids already entered (between 0 and 3).
pHand - The cards in the hand of the player entering the bid.
Returns:
A valid bid (higher than the last bid, or pass).

selectCardsToDiscard

public CardList selectCardsToDiscard(Bid[] pBids,
                                     int pIndex,
                                     Hand pHand)
Description copied from interface: ICardExchangeStrategy
Select exactly 6 cards from the 16 cards in pHand (basic deal plus widow), to remove from the hand.

Specified by:
selectCardsToDiscard in interface ICardExchangeStrategy
Parameters:
pBids - The bids for this round. An array of 4 elements.
pIndex - The index of the player in this round. Between 0 and 3 incl.
pHand - The hand of cards for this player, with the widow added in.
Returns:
Six cards to remove from the hand.

play

public Card play(Trick pTrick,
                 Hand pHand)
Description copied from interface: IPlayingStrategy
Selects a card to be played by the player. This method should have no side effect, i.e., it should not remove any cards from Hand.

Specified by:
play in interface IPlayingStrategy
Parameters:
pTrick - Cards played so far in the trick. Note that the number of cards in pTrick determines the playing order of the player. For example, if pTrick.size() == 0, the player leads. If pTrick.size() == 1, he plays second, etc.
pHand - The hand of the player to play.
Returns:
One of the cards in pHand. The card must be a legal play, that is, follow suit if possible.
